tool.name: trim sff primers
tool.command:
uncompress_tgz.py -i $libdir -o trim_sff_primers_input; trim_sff_primers.py -l trim_sff_primers_input -m $input_map #if $use_sfftools: --use_sfftools #end if
#if $debug: --debug #end if

param.label: -l/--libdir: The directory containing per-library sff files
param.name: libdir

param.label: -m/--input_map: Path to the input mapping file describing the libraries
param.name: input_map

param.label: --use_sfftools: Use external sffinfo and sfffile programs instead of equivalent Python implementation.
param.name: use_sfftools

param.label: --debug: Print command-line output for debugging [default: False]
param.name: debug

tool.help: Finds the technical read regions for each library, and resets the left trim. This script replaces the original sff files with the trimmed versions.
